results.title: Fourteen rats and a ratcatcher (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Francesco Tenze

results.title: Fourteen Days in May
results.brief_description: In May 1987, Edward Earl Johnson, a black American convicted of murdering a white town marshal, was executed. This haunting document follows the last day of his life. In the final days and hours of Johnson’s life, the filmmakers observed the lawyer’s desperate fight to save his client’s life, and it becomes obvious how the prison doctors, chaplain, wardens and other inmates feel both about Johnson’s guilt and about the death penalty itself.

results.title: Four weddings and a funeral (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Duncan Kenworthy, PolyGram, Channel Four, Working Title Films and Mike Newell
results.brief_description: This charming and quirky British romantic comedy stars Hugh Grant and Andy Macdowell as the two lovers who belong together…perhaps! An excellent cast, including an hilarious cameo by Rowan Atkinson as the tongued-tied vicar, “Four weddings & a funeral” is unashamedly sentimental, but at the same time reveals not only the “funny side” of relationships, but their fragility. As Hugh Grant catapaults from one emotional and social disaster to another, due to an excess of good manners and a very British tendency towards “keeping a stiff upper lip”, he eventually discovers that the course of true love diverges from his expected course down the altar.

results.title: Four ways to drama (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division and Norman G. Dyhrenfurth
results.brief_description: Presents four versions of a short dramatic episode - stage, radio, television and motion pictures - using the same plot and character to illustrate and compare the requirements of each medium.

results.title: Four views on landscape
results.brief_description: This film prvides an animated reconstruction of some of the major works of Constable, Turner, Van Gogh and Monet. The simple level of the animation and screen text make it suitable for use at primary level.

results.title: Four seasons in the life of Ludovic
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Leduc, ONF | NFB and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: A compilation of the complete series of Ludovic, an animated classic about a young teddybear. In “Snow Gift”, Ludovic watches the snow outside the thatched cottage in which he lives with his family and dreams of tobogganing with his friends. His parents tell him he is too little, and Ludovic feels lonely, so he invents wonderful games to share with his new found friend, a doll that came to life. In “A Crocodile in my Garden”, Ludovic organises his origami jungle animals to go on a spring picnic in his garden. The mood degenerates as the animals disobey Ludovic and fight but all is resolved happily when cookies are distributed and the animals learn to share. In “Visiting Grandpa” Ludovic spends the afternoon with Grandpa on the farm, tending the animals and the garden, and though they miss grandma very much they find that her magic is still around. In “Magic in the Air” Ludovic happily plays in the playground when another teddy tries to befriend him, or so he thinks until he is knocked to the ground. Ludovic is rescued by a smiling girl teddy. Ludovic and his new friend find ways to out-smart the bully. The leaves, the trees and even the sand castle help out and soon the bully leaves him alone. But the magic doesn’t stop there and soon it is used to help cheer up the mad and sad bully. Each episode is also available as separate titles.

results.title: Four seasons
results.brief_description: The four seasons in one of Canada’s many wildlife sanctuaries - Gatineau Park. In a variety of scenes picturing the colorful pageantry of the months, the lives of its wild birds and beasts, the seasonal economy of farms and forests, the film builds up a cumulative impression of this region in the Laurentian mountains of Canada. Photography by Radford Crawley, Grant Crabtree and Judith Crawley, with music by Maurice Blackburn.

results.title: Four score years and then
results.brief_description: Looks at the rehabilitation geriatric ward at St. James Hospital, South West London, and some of its patients, most of them over 80. Peter Millard, Professor of geriatric medicine, believes the very old can be made well again if they are given a belief in themselves. The program follows the progress of a number of patients.
